docs.title: CellCanvas
docs.text:
CellCanvas is a tool for building geometric models of cellular architecture from images.

CellCanvas combines machine learning with interactive visualization to facilitate the creation of geometric representations of cellular architectures.

docs.title: What can CellCanvas do?
docs.text:
• interactive segmentation when there is no ground truth
  • extract complex geometries

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
1. Install album

  2. Setup the CellCanvas album catalog: 

album add-catalog https://github.com/cellcanvas/album-catalog
  1. Browse the catalog.

docs.title: Tutorial: Remote Workflow
docs.text:
Step 1: Follow the quick start

Step 2: Install the server on the worker: album install cellcanvas:server:0.0.2

Step 3: Make a tunnel to the worker: ssh -L 8080:worker-host:8000 user.name@login-host -N

Step 4: Launch the server on the worker: album run cellcanvas:server:0.0.2

Step 5: Install the config file fetecher on your local machine: album install cellcanvas:fetch-config:0.0.1 --filepath <my_path>

Step 6: Install the client on your local machine: album install cellcanvas:napari-cellcanvas:0.0.1 --copick_config_path <my_path>

Step 7: Launch the client on your local machine: album run cellcanvas:napari-cellcanvas:0.0.1 --copick_config_path <my path>
